documents.document: The sun baker (with apologies to Max Dupain). https://t.co/pub62fZbti

The crew wait around the corner as the drone operator controls the action. https://t.co/b7ufEADlxv
The serenity is invaded by a drone following the star through the forest. https://t.co/BSegFf4uiq

The actual site of the Stringbark Creek bail-up. https://t.co/FfdDEj7Apk
Bizarrely, a stringybark grows over a plaque to the three murdered police at Stringybark Creek. https://t.co/Hj3eUomfsA
For all the romance about Ned, we must remember he was a cop killer. Bad tactic; fundamentally flawed strategy. https://t.co/osIMQiXRfR
As against the re-enactments in the tourist traps on the main drag. https://t.co/XzvL7GfoZP
Glenrowan has completely out-manoeuvred graffiti by using pebblecrete walls. https://t.co/3ovDUZnHn5
The lock-up where Ned served a prison sentence when aged 16. https://t.co/ZFaiyx0eMB
Wounded, Ned sent away the armed supporters who wanted to fight and declare the Republic of North East Victoria. Pi… https://t.co/4ComGAxKtQ
The site to the side of the pub where Ned was shot down. Sponsored by Hume Pipes. https://t.co/ZHdl1Td5J2
A crowd gathered to watch the show. https://t.co/fwf26iIZZd
The black trackers were placed right out the front of the pub while the white cops stayed well back and to the side… https://t.co/HlLIUg6aYO
The eye slits hide reflectors which wink at you from peculiar angles. https://t.co/5vGjQ3ODsI
Some stylised Augmented Reality poles suggest the action...but, really, how about the people who were burnt alive? https://t.co/ennERBmwt6
Today, the site of the siege is a suburban sheep paddock. https://t.co/vk4B2fS2vR
The Glenrowan Inn starts to smoulder. Rather anti-climactic ACTUAL PHOTO. https://t.co/P4uhoyXM4P
Having avoided visiting Kelly Country all my life, it seemed churlish to drive right past. https://t.co/CtgCC0BSjP
Open fireplaces (yes, plural) in the camp kitchen makes one suspect winters in Wangaratta may be chilly. https://t.co/COfYxvHbY7
Short pitch and conduit wickets: no wonder the Indians beat us if this is all we can dish up for our kids. https://t.co/lewNYTwA1D
Back for the second test: yep, world famous certified milkshakes. https://t.co/8q18WIPFQF
Detail of Everton Bus Shelter facilities. Note that someone moved Pandy. https://t.co/JFE65P7Im8
Everton Bus Shelter without smell today. https://t.co/RD6KML3dJy
Better than Cooktown Bakery, the previous record holder. https://t.co/8dgEt1ac4u

The Everton Toilet, so signed in case you think you've slipped into another dimension. https://t.co/66L54hGLVN
The Everton Bus Shelter. Go there, Gladys. Lounges AND a panda bear, even for economy class passengers. https://t.co/Zv7CZliOYo
The Everton Hotel, from whence the boys no doubt went to war and no doubt some returned to build the monument. https://t.co/181dRjtGwa
If you missed the flagship store, there is another on the corner one block away complete with flapping bees in the… https://t.co/Brj7tDMoAx
This, however, IS a painto. Zoom in for correct spelling on the window. https://t.co/wJxbczTuWW
No, it's not a painto. There were live bees; top that Apple! https://t.co/nZFiCV54Jx
Then there is the flagship store for Beechworth Honey. Think Apple Store only sweeter. https://t.co/jKi94GmcEu
Spiritual home of the franchise. Not sure why is does so well; think hundreds and thousands. https://t.co/00rF2p7Qza
Now that's a picnic table setting in Beechworth Park. https://t.co/HX85WZv4dd
You can still send a telegram for $2 to anywhere in Australia. I remember them fondly but couldn't think what to say https://t.co/bv1P6L6XMJ
Amazingly, the Beechworth Post Office building is still a Post Office. https://t.co/EXlcehEL29
More gas lamps converted to low energy bulbs. Sad for historical Beechworth. https://t.co/xjpoQ1vHUl
The looooongest gum leaf ever rested momentarily on my bonnet. https://t.co/uloAbY9Xfc
Everton gave 8 of its sons to the Great War (3 from one family) but only 3 to WWII. Smart. https://t.co/YxxcEzGmHm
Yes, it could do with some more upmarket context. But first, move the power lines. https://t.co/MCrVKLvcU7
Curious, this charity tin made me go searching. https://t.co/SlFovJCrYv
The same doll used in the Kyabram window display about the evils of alcohol was sulking in a corner of Everton Stor… https://t.co/vLrzDlTRPk
Yep, it deserves to be world famous. $5.20 for malted. Don't drive past Everton General Store. https://t.co/PENWQbMeze
Only the senior staff get to make the milkshakes, and the boss yells out "Better make it good." https://t.co/ChXbbRbBm5
Well, how could you drive past that inducement. https://t.co/PrHzdzUGtt
Bark home detox watched jealously by a more primitive Xanthorrea. https://t.co/XF0MIjkw9Y

A rod for your own back. https://t.co/udfnw1rRC3
No photo from Pangarang Lookout because I turned back here. No sign telling me how far the walk would be and BORING. https://t.co/XKzLfkLGf9

This mid-Murray island is claimed by both NSW and Victoria. Must be good fishing. https://t.co/XXpu40DWym
Nobody else can walk the Murray mud so no bath today. https://t.co/IgSYFedSqO
I am delighted to report that the Haversack is alive and well. First sighting in decades and still only $9.90. https://t.co/9TpsXK1NCx
And I'm seriously fucked up by being captive and on display in the main street. https://t.co/96k3TeuxGi
THIS is the sex shop in Echuca; part of a bridal boutique and fancy dress hire!!! OK, back to the toy shop. https://t.co/2bAIMES9OW
It's a toy shop for men. Play, not sex. In Echuca. https://t.co/n7XQcByHob

Mr Shackell bought the building in 1865 and added a new section at the back featuring the Star of David. So there. https://t.co/nluYYkVDR5
One must credit the Christmas trees for their originality. But it's February. https://t.co/71IUykaJvs
A timber jinker sports cross-section-of-a-tree wheels: that's like asking someone to dig their own grave. https://t.co/N4lRVDu3Zr
Echuca has managed to retain a street in the historical precinct with a real dirt road. https://t.co/ntQ4cdGZJe
Yes, but how did she get there without getting wet. https://t.co/ZFe6OfvcmO
Nothing so pathetic as a maggie with a beak full of nesting but undecided what to do with it. https://t.co/irGmDxVRRr
First recorded sighting of the Indigenous letter Nj on a building. (Renovated 1988). https://t.co/EeM5D8loOs

The spa has washed down this far with the recent floods. https://t.co/OLkG4JEfJf

The body pick-up van is hidden behind a hedge but no one is fooled. https://t.co/aQZn9KbgKz
A failure to kern made me think on first glance that the funeral parlour was named 'To Bin' (...or not to bin?) https://t.co/TA0LQTRYED

There was an earlier time when coffee was popular, but the men, despite looking like hipsters, did not barist. https://t.co/rDk1nAjIKr

The Port of Echuca is guarded by the Thong Gates. https://t.co/5KbOuge97R
Just for you vexillologists, here is the river boats' ensign. https://t.co/Y2vpPzpDNs
This one boasts 'Genuine Steam': one would never want to be out on the water with ingenuine steam. https://t.co/MIevsRSQsH
Paddle steamers do a nice trade in tourists these days. https://t.co/YbWTdmv00M

The Murray is also full of snags. https://t.co/4S2e5eNQA5
The Murray does repeated hairpin bends; in fact, it's recidivist. https://t.co/6jE1VOfDGH
Sunset on the Murray. https://t.co/WadEgj2YQ9
Leunig's 1990s entry for a new Aussie flag featured a speedboat. When I'm dictator, they will be outlawed as moroni… https://t.co/VoCREUfRGm
A lopped gum was traduced into service as a lost thong monument but, Phoenix-like, it objects with a new shoot. https://t.co/ddPszXdWFw
River Red Gums proudly flutter the flag over the Murray River for Australia Day. That's NSW on yonder bank. https://t.co/4gr8ziERcv
Mt Terrick Terrick is covered in moss and lichen, even on the north side. One suspects winters are bleak. https://t.co/Mtg9T30Wlq
Terrick Terrick NP is really about remnant Cyprus Pines and native grasslands. The rock is just a lure. https://t.co/D8dULBhIDV
Wheat silos used to be a status symbol in country towns; a big blue bag of wheat on the ground is not as grand. https://t.co/f137WoIL7V
The flatness from whence they shoot. https://t.co/F0j2DUKUum
